thread.title: Greggs Delivered has started taking online orders in Manchester city centre - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Greggs Delivered has started taking online orders in Manchester city centre - Manchester Evening News

author: Simon Binns
title: Greggs Delivered has started taking online orders in Manchester city centre - Manchester Evening News
text:
What's On Greggs Delivered has started taking online orders in Manchester city centre Two Manchester city centre stores have started trialling Greggs Delivered - meaning you can now order an array of sarnies, sausage rolls and pasties online. Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Manchester City FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
There are days you will remember all your life. Leaving school, the birth of a child - and the day Greggs started delivering to your home/office. 
For Manchester pastry fans, that day has come, as two Manchester city centre stores have started trialling Greggs Delivered - meaning you can now order an array of sarnies, sausage rolls and pasties online. And sweets treats such as doughnuts. 
Because walking to the bakery is for losers, right? 
You can now order from stores at King Street and Brazzenose Street via the Greggs Delivered website , where you'll need to order a minimum of Â£20. (Photo: Andrew James) Two American-style dessert bars with OTT treats are opening in Manchester 
Manchester has form for bakery fandom, and just this weekend saw hour-long queues outside backstreet artisan dough makers Pollen, which is building up a reputation for superb croissants, cruffins and loaves of top-notch bread. 
At the other end though, is Greggs, the mass market high street behemoth, which now wants to make ordering even easier at a handful of its 1,700 branches. 
Greggs Delivered is expected to increase the number of Manchester stores taking online delivery orders following the initial trial. Other cities taking part are London and Newcastle. Read More
